item.title: Testing Emacs programs with Buttercup
item.description: Buttercup is a testing framework for emacs-lisp. It is used by large projects like Clojure's CIDER to write clean, concise, and descriptive tests. I introduce Buttercup and build up to advanced usages with the faint, unlikely dream that some Emacs programmer decides to add tests to their library... What is Buttercup? Introduction Buttercup's entry points are: describe, it, and expect. We describe a test suite with a name. Test cases within the possibly nested suites are done with it and assertions as expect blocks within.
